page.title: 01INTRODUCTION & Farming
page.content:
Here are the small hamlets of Old Ellerby and West Newton, together with the{Stately Home}of Burton Constable Hall and its associated Country Park, all set in a farming community.
{Farming}is the major aspect of this gently rolling rural landscape, with the emphasis on arable land.{Crops}are cereals, wheat and barley, rotated with 'rest' crops of oilseed rape, grass and potatoes. Generally the {fields}are large, some 40 acres, with few hedges, but in the village of West Newton fields are much smaller, and there is a{dairy}farm of about 90 acres. The pasture also supports some {beef}cattle and a few{sheep.}Under cover,{pigs}and{chickens}are raised on some of the farms.
